text: Akira Kano at the 2013 IPC Alpine Skiing World Champions|thumb Akira Kano (狩野 亮 Kanō Akira?) (born March 14, 1986) is a skier from Japan. He has a disability and uses a wheelchair. He skied at the 2011 IPC Alpine Skiing World Championships and was the first skier to finish in the sitting men's downhill race. ==References== Category:Japanese skiers Category:1986 births Category:Living people
title: Akira Kano
